comment: Symptoms and signs: Aboveground symptoms are more visible on seedlings than older plants. Plants grow poorly in uneven patches randomly distributed throughout the field. Symptoms on roots are different depending upon host. A much-branched root system is charateristic. Root division takes place at the point of juvenile invasion, giving the appearance of bushy, knotted root system. Several white cysts are usually visible at each knot. The cysts are a glistening white gray initially and dark brown when mature.
Symptoms and signs: Root-knot nematodes cause small galls or clublike thickenings on the roots of wheat plants.
Symptoms and signs: The root damage caused by nematode feeding and migration often within the roots results in extansive cortical damage, disrupting root function.
